current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and
		  Management Act to add Rhode Island to the Mid-Atlantic Fishery Management
		  Council.

text.#text:
Rhode Island
			 fishermen participate in fisheries managed by the New England Fishery
			 Management Council (hereinafter referred to as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
but does not have voting membership on the
			 MAFMC.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Magnuson-Stevens Fishery
			 Conservation and Management Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act

text.#text:
Rhode Island
			 currently has voting membership on the NEFMC under the

Rhode Island
			 lands more MAFMC-managed stocks than any other MAFMC member except the State of
			 New Jersey.

A higher
			 percentage of Rhode Island’s commercial landings (by weight or value)
			 traditionally have come from species that are managed by the MAFMC as compared
			 to species managed by NEFMC.

MAFMC has found
			 that Rhode Island’s circumstance parallels that of Florida and North Carolina,
			 which each have voting membership on two different fishery management
			 councils.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 302(a)(1)(B) of the Magnuson-Stevens
